page.title: 18Church times
page.content: { The Reorganised Church of Jesus {Christ of Latter Day Saints}celebrates its 50th anniversary in Stockingford, Nuneaton in June 1985. The first Sunday School met in the 3rd Sunday in June 1935 in the front room of{John Coggan's bakery/house}in {Haunchwood Road.}They soon had to use the garage as the congregation grew and in 1940 they bought and converted a woodcutter's yard in{Whittleford {Road}and used it as their church for 35 years,even when the roof was bombed in the war.In 1975 the church moved to larger premises further down the road. The church aims to be a service to the community through weddings, funerals, the blessing of children and midweek activities such as youth groups, mother and toddler groups as well as weekly church school and evening worship services.
